text:
League 1
PSG - Marquinhos: "I won fans in Morocco"
Brazilian international, the defender lives since his arrival in France with a joke sticking to his skin, initiated by Julien Cazarre a few years ago.
05 Nov 2019, 13:20 by Thomas Rassouli



Alfred GomisDijonIcon Sport



Youcef AtalOGC NiceIcon Sport



William SalibaASSEIcon Sport



Edson MexerBordeauxIcon Sport



Jordan AmaviOMIcon Sport



Didier NdongDijonIcon Sport



Baptiste SantamariaAngersIcon Sport



Gael KakutaAmiensIcon Sport



Ui-jo HwangBordeauxIcon Sport



Memphis DepayOLIcon Sport



Denis BouangaASSEIcon Sport



StÃ©phane JobardDijonIcon Sport

Bouanga, Depay, Amavi ... the typical team of the weekend in Ligue 1




We never tired of redoing the sequence. A few years ago, Marquinhos is not one of the most miraculous transfers of Paris Saint-Germain, but the defender begins to make a place in the Parisian eleven at the time. At the end of a meeting, the humorist labeled round ball Julien Cazarre calls to ask him if he is ready to play with Morocco. On Twitter since, the joke has not aged.




"But Marqui, come and play CAN!"




Marquinhos + 12 ðŸ“·Credit Photo - Icon Sport

For the magazine of Paris Saint-Germain, the player came back on this joke. "You know I got messages from people saying to me," But Marqui, come play the CAN! "Sometimes I even meet people in the street who are convinced that I'm Moroccan. really Moroccan origins? "This joke took on an incredible dimension." he confides.
Before relativising. "But it's cool all that, I even won fans in Morocco because of this story, and I'm going to be invited to have a vacation there at that rate (laughs). 'had a family more now'.
Â Â Marquinhos: all information about the player
